website_summaries.verdict: A good amount of cleaning power for a great price.
pros: Includes a 2-in-1 water tank for easy filling and emptying
Able to clean a large area before needing to refill
cons: Not as powerful as more expensive models, but still does a great job

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, especially with kids and a multi-pet household! NOTE: DO NOT use heat or hot water on pet stains and soiled areas! Use cool water. Heat sets the odor; even if you can't smell it, Fluffy and Fido can! This is advice from16+ years in the veterinary field.
customer_reviews.author: AMD

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Used once
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Used once, it started smoking, the belt melted fast and I had to return it. Plus I had to pay to return it AND pay to have UPS pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worst carpet cleaner ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst carpet cleaner ever. We bought new expensive carpet and thought we would get a new carpet cleaner at that time because the one we had was getting old. Big mistake. There is nothing good about this cleaner. The access to the water tank is frankly just stupid. Every action is difficult and not at all user friendly. The on/off button is in a very strange place which is not at all handy. I have now had it less than six months and it is on its way to the repair shop. Glad I kept my old one. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Baran

customer_reviews.title: WARNING
customer_reviews.text: The GOOD: Although the Bissell cleans Ok you really need to use a good pre-cleaner to get a good job. I used Resolve powder and a brush first. The Bad: What the manual does not advise you is after you are done using the cleaner take it off the carpet or hard wood floor because it drips dirty water in a line in the front of the unit where the brushes have splashed it onto the surrounding housing. I left it on the carpet for a short time while the carpet dried and I empty the bucket- what a mess to clean that single line of now dried dirty water that dripped on the carpet. WARNING
customer_reviews.author: Leader77

customer_reviews.title: Works Grrrreat
customer_reviews.text: I had a Bissell carpet cleaner a couple years ago. Worked like a champ. This one does too for half of the price, but... the water chamber is a lot smaller. Like way smaller. You have to dump and refill A LOT. But, I turned it into a fun drinking game which made it a lot more bearable. Every time I have to dump and refill it I do a shot. My carpet looks amazing and I'm hammered on a Sunday afternoon. I'd call that a win win situation.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: This is second one I have had that broke down ...
customer_reviews.text: This is second one I have had that broke down after a couple of years. I cleaned it thoroughly after using, etc., but it just dies for no reason
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I would give zero stars if I could. I have had two. Returned the first. The second went unused as I moved in to a tiled house and didn't need it that often. Upon the 5th or 6th use, it spontaneously quit. Just like the first. Total piece of crap and waste of money. I took great care of it, stored and cleaned it according to manufacturers recommendations. Don't waste your time or cash on this.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Tiffany vannoy

customer_reviews.title: ... Feb 28 used it five times now it won't suck water up
customer_reviews.text: Bought product on Feb 28 used it five times now it won't suck water up. The worst money I ever spent. I cannot find a way to even contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working after a handful of times and after only having for 3 months. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: cassi olson

customer_reviews.title: Was Skeptical, but it works!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this last year because I really got tired of paying someone to clean my carpets. The first time I used it, it did a wonderful job with the solution that came with the machine. The second time used, I added a booster to the water and did an even better job. The 3rd time, ho-ho-ho...I have BRAND NEW CARPET!!! I watched a video on Youtube on cleaning the carpet and took the advice from one of he fellow carpet cleaners, who suggested putting a little powdered "borax" in the water, boy did that do an even better job. Love my machine and all that it does.
customer_reviews.author: Ajae

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: I originally posted this for 3 stars but after much frustration I am revising and giving it only one. If I could return this product I would. It is constantly loosing suction for no apparent reason. I have to shut the machine off and turn it back on after several minutes for it to start working again. I had previously purchased a Bissell on a black Friday sale and was beyond pleased but this cheaper model comes no where close to any kind of replacement for it. I am stuck with this for now though, buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Luckiecharms

customer_reviews.title: Loved it for all of 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it didn’t after minimal use (maybe 4 times on small area rugs). Suddenly, it will no longer dispense water. It still suctions great but what good is that if I can’t actually clean anything? Of course, the return window closed 3 weeks ago...
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Carpet Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight carpet cleaner. It is just right for most apartments, but is a bit small for a house. The biggest limitation is the tank size which is a bit small, but keeps the unit light and easy to maneuver. The unit I bought did not have the hand brush unit which I didn't need with my furniture. Suction with this unit is a bit low, so going back over cleaned areas several times for dry pick up is recommended. This unit should last 3-4 years with nominal use. This makes it a great and economic alternative to renting a rug cleaner or a professional cleaner. Rated 4 stars because of the small tank size and low suction.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Well no matter what I tried to trouble shot nothing worked to get it to suck up the dirty water
customer_reviews.text: I looked at alot of rug shampooers and looked at the reviews, This is the one I decided on, Well no matter what I tried to trouble shot nothing worked to get it to suck up the dirty water. I've taken it apart, checked the hoses.cleaned it out put it back together still sucked up like a teaspoon of dirty water. Surely it should suck up more then that after you use the whole clean water bladder. I'm very dis pointed and upset. Something that should be pretty easy is now a soaked rug!!! And I didn't even do all the area I needed done! And I'm out 80 bucks I spent for this.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa White

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids and dog messes
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog and 2 toddlers and this cleans right through the messes. I have had this carpet cleaner for about a year and it is still working. It cleans super good and the solution sample was wonderful. the only downside of this particular model is it does have a very small water tank so only can do about one room at a time and there is no hose attachment to clean furniture and etc.
customer_reviews.author: Britnay Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Easy to assemble and easy to use. I cleaned my beige carpet that hadn't been cleaned since i moved into my mobile home last may. I did the 16x16 heavily soiled living room and it took about 3 hours to clean with prep and reassemble of room and cleaning of shampooer. It came out excellent. A couple of the heavy spots still need work but they're much better. I'll redo when I do the bedrooms. Drying time was the most 2hrs. I was going to rent a machine at Lowes for $40 but saw this for $80 on Amazon and decided to take a chance Glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: dennis n

customer_reviews.title: Pump belt broke on 2 out of 3 cleanings
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this shampooer 3 times. The pump belt has broken twice. I am only cleaning 2, 5x8 area rugs so it’s not overuse. The belt is very difficult to change. So today getting ready for guests tomorrow and wanted to freshen up as I have pets. No heavy duty cleaning. Completed about 1/4 of the rug and the belt broke. I know I can’t return it so I’m throwing it out. Too unreliable. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: SylviaSue

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but after cleaning 1 carpet
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but after cleaning 1 carpet. I tried cleaning another and it would not spray water!!! Turns out the belt was defective and broke!!! Very disappointed. I hope they will send me a new belt and a back up or it is going back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Please help

customer_reviews.title: I'm amazed at how well it did
customer_reviews.text: I had some very difficult stains that were there for years. Black, hard spots that you could feel with your feet for the most part. I was wondering if a professional carpet cleaning company could get them out. I saw this and the reviews for it and decided to give it a try. I pre-treated the carpet as suggested and then used this the next day when it arrived. I'm amazed at how well it did. I can't see any of the stains any more. It did require a lot of refills to do a small area. I probably got two and a half lines per refill.
customer_reviews.author: jinx10000

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Had to refill the bladder several times just to clean one small area of carpet. The machine spit back out black deposits on the carpet, so after cleaning the carpet you have to go back and vacuum over the carpet to vacuum up all the black deposits spit out by the machine. As far as the cleaning goes, it does not cleaning very well. It requires you to go over the carpet several times. I have fairly small bedrooms. The smallest bedroom took me an hour and a half to clean the carpets and I had to change the bladder 8 * to clean this room.
customer_reviews.author: Rena G

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We were very impressed with this machine! Glad we did not spend more money for a newer, fancier model. It was easy to put together, simple to use, no problem to dump, worked extremely well, and made our 12 year old carpets seem like new. All of the old stains came up easily without pre-treatment. The only reason I did not give it five stars was because it took most of the day for the carpets to dry (AC & fans blowing) and that was an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Coby's Corner

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for home cleaner
customer_reviews.text: GREAT price, actually works very well for a home shampooer. The water has to be cleaned obnoxiously often. You have to clean the entire under carriage after use or it will drip putrid puddles onto the floor where it is stored. Doesn't totally get up stains, but can help damage control. Definitely didn't rid the carpet of puppy spots, even when used immediately.
customer_reviews.author: holyMOLy

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up GREAT after 2 long haired cats, 1 bulldog, 1 son & 1 husband
customer_reviews.text: I use it about every 2 weeks. Seriously easy as vacuuming!! Recently moved & we used dawn dish soap mixed with baking soda & hot water as usual -- it cleaned up the light beige carpets GREAT after 2 long haired cats, 1 bulldog, 1 son & 1 husband so well that landlord thought we hired professional!! I wish I didn't have to change the water so much (about 3 times to do a regular sized bedroom), but that's really just me being lazy.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah GL

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Spend more and get a real two section carpet cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: Well, after about 10 months and maybe 4-5 uses, you get what you pay for. Cheap plastic parts falling apart. Machine has to be constantly cleaned in order for it work properly. Bladder (cheap plastic inner bag) does not function very well. A few days ago, after a thorough cleaning, could hardly get machine to pick up any dirty water. The bottom brushes easily get tangled up (yes, I vacuumed thoroughly first), the pick up of dirty water is horrible, and cleaning power is gone after just a few uses. Cleaning process is laborious!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I’d say it’s good, but definitely doesn’t get deep enough into the carpet and drips once you turn it off, so you have to be careful where you set it down on the carpet once you’re done. I recommend placing a towel down for it. However some of the easier spots in my carpet it did effectively get up. It’s a good product if you just need your carpet cleaned not for super deep stains though.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: New review..
customer_reviews.text: Can you be in love with a steam cleaner? I am! This powerful, spinning brush pulls dirt out of my carpet as well as pet fur and fluffs up the carpet as well. It sucks up most of the water so the carpet dries faster. One of my favorite purchases ever! Well, I've used this about 8 times now and the first time was the charm. I am having trouble at this point with the machine always sucking up the water/soap it puts out and the bucket on the inside filling up with the water it is supposed to suck up. I'm so sad because the first time I used it, I couldn't believe how well it worked.
customer_reviews.author: laurajrc1961

customer_reviews.title: TANK WAY TOO SMALL!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with another reviewer, the tank is way too small. The only carpet in my home is in 3 bedrooms. The other rooms are vinyl. I can barely shampoo the smallest bedroom before cleaning the tank. If you live in a small apartment, I guess this is a good one to purchase. If you have a medium to large size area to clean, I suggest to look at another model.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale. I know it’s doing the job just by looking at the water. It’s super easy to use. I also use nature’s miracle shampoo solution because it’s way cheaper than Bissell’s and I haven’t had any issues. A negative that I have is that it’s really hard to clean the hair out of the ground triangular piece. Also, it’s pretty frustrating that I can get like 3-4 good rows of cleaning but then it’s time to replace the water. It would be nice if the water compartment was bigger so you didn’t have to make so many trips to clean out the dirty water. Overall a good product and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: I have not used it yet, but....
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet, but here is my review of physical features: Pros: -Lightweight (can carry around easy) -Easy assembly, just need a screw driver to screw 3 screws in. -The tank is 2-in-1 (this could be a con, but helps make it lightweight) Cons: -Since the tank is 2-in-1, the clean water/soap goes in a plastic blister type bag and I assume dirty water pushes into it as it fills. Seems cheap, but I will update my review once I use it. Do not add scolding hot water, you may melt the bag or crack the tank. -Feels cheap and thin (but again this may contribute to the lightweight)
customer_reviews.author: TanyaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: For Light duty only!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. I used to steam clean professionally. Only thing I do not like about this item is that when you are applying water and soap solution to your carpets, the machine automatically is sucking it back up before it has a chance to scrub and or soak in good. Most steam cleaners have a pump and vacuum switch so you can use the machine to scrub a spot as long as you need to. Not this one....as soon as you press the trigger, you can see the soap being sucked up.. thats not what I want... so this item is only ideal for light steam cleaning. If you have dogs or kids,... this will further upset you.
customer_reviews.author: Theone

customer_reviews.title: After reading the reviews about this shampooer I’m highly disappointed. I received mine today & decided to go ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews about this shampooer I’m highly disappointed. I received mine today & decided to go ahead and clean my carpet in the living room.... once the water was fully out I went to dump it and there was barely any water in there to dump. During the time I was shampooing it “looked” like it was sucking the water back up, but apparently it was not. 😡
customer_reviews.author: UnDreUgh

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think this was going to be as good as my really expensive one but hey... not bad not bad.... my previous one had all the bells and whistles (rinse, auto wash, etc)... however, this one is truly a deep shampoo only... 1 container that has a bladder inside for fresh water and as dirty water comes up it goes to the outside of bladder! Really did an amazing job!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall E Williams

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical initially because there are positive as well as negative reviews. What made me decide on this was I have a good neighbor who show me his Bissell (same model as mine) and have used it over one yr without issue. Since I received mine, I used it once and it took care of the decade-old dirty marks (coffee spill, dark streaks) all over my light color carpet. I am sure the professional steam cleaning service will do a better job but it costs lots more. Based on the cost and result criteria, I am happy with this DIY carpet cleaner. It is easy to set up and clean up after use.
customer_reviews.author: barracuda

customer_reviews.title: Great carpet cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very impressive carpet shampooer. The quality exceeded my expectations. I had HORRIBLE stains on my floor that had been there for 2 years. It removed at least 85% of the stains. It looks 100x better. I did a quick clean on my carpets basically just to get a feel of how well it was gonna work. Very impressed. Will be taking the time to do a full clean soon. I recommend this carpet cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Fern

customer_reviews.title: Great Carpet Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this carpet cleaner. I have a new puppy and carpet, which is a bad combination. She had several accidents and nothing I tried got out the smell and stains. This cleaner did a great job on both. I was surprised and happy how great my carpet looked after I shampooed with the Bissel. It even removed some older stains (not puppy related) that I have lived with for years. I am thrilled! Fortunately, my puppy has fewer accidents but I'm happy to have this great little cleaner on hand just in case. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Tee

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: I just used my carpet cleaner for the first time. It was easy to use, the instruction easy to follow, it worked well and picked up a ton of dirt. I would give this 5 stars, BUT, I noticed 3 pieces of plastic on the carpet and when I inspected the machine, the plastic piece covering the power brush had cracked after just one use and so far, 3 pieces are completely gone at the corner and since the crack is across the whole guard, I am assuming by the next, second use, this piece will be nearly completely gone. I sure miss the old Made in USA days when things lasted for than one or two uses.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy H Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Nope...
customer_reviews.text: The capacity of this carpet scrubber is so small you'll be able to cancel your gym membership, the suction is so inconsistent it'll leave the floor as streaky as an extremely bad spray tan, after four hours of use it's developed a whine like a tiny drone managed to get sucked up inside, now it's making weird chugging noises like a steam engine that won't make it up any hills. Yes I vacuumed with a very nice bissel vacuum until it couldn't suck anything up. It has not been a good product for me.
customer_reviews.author: WonderDog

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Carpets For The Win
customer_reviews.text: This was a "big girl" purchase after bringing my first puppy into my apartment. He never had/has any accidents, but our carpets do tend to get a pretty "doggy" smell after a while. The carpet cleaner has definitely made that a thing of the past! The unit is easy to assemble and easy to fill with cleaners and dump out all of the dirty water. I would suggest this to anyone who need a carpet cleaner in a friendlier price range.
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Spot cleaner and not much else
customer_reviews.text: Product makes for a good spot cleaner but not for much else, the tank for the cleaner is small and there isn’t a convenient way to empty the dirty water out of it. It also does not get along with pet hair and has a tendency to leave dirty rolls of hair behind on the carpet. The vacuum also has a tendency to leak after use. As long as you’re only cleaning small areas it does a decent job for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Feranec

customer_reviews.title: don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I used this machine 3 times and now it won't suck up water or anything. I've done the trouble shooting pages and nothing. I haven't even had it a month! I've tried to call the company multiple times and I sit on hold so long I have to hang up. guess I'm out the money I spent on it and have to get a new one. Definitely would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Had for 2 years. Used on pet stains. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats and a dog. I’ve had this carpet cleaner for 2 years now and it still works just as great as when I first got it. For the best results you should vacuum the carpet with a vacuum first. Then clean the carpet with this carpet cleaner. Your results will vary depending on the carpet cleaning solution you use. Buying a Walmart brand carpet cleaner solution does not work as well as buying the Bissell brand carpet cleaning solution. I buy their Pet carpet cleaning solution and it works amazing. It deodorizes my carpet and pulls up stains.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes W.

customer_reviews.title: We were worried we may have to already replace the carpet but after 1hr of using this carpet cleaner our floor looks better than
customer_reviews.text: We built our house this past September and choose a dark cream color for our carpet. We also have an 1 year old Pitbull who doesn't have full control of his bladder and there were dark pee lines all around the back door. We were worried we may have to already replace the carpet but after 1hr of using this carpet cleaner our floor looks better than it did when we moved in! My wife loves it and we will certainly be using it as the floor gets dirty with normal wear. We also recommend the oxy-based pre-treatment for stains that have had time to set.
customer_reviews.author: Felscream

customer_reviews.title: order extra belts
customer_reviews.text: The cleaner itself works very well. Cleans with ease. Lightweight and easy to use. The major problem I had was that the first time using the cleaner, the water belt broke. Really, within one hour of actually getting the package. I ordered 3 of both belts from Bissell.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Helper
customer_reviews.text: I really love having this carpet cleaner in my home. Previously, I rented a large, bulky steamer from a home appliance store. I needed to take a taxi to get it home and one to return it with 24 hours to complete my entire carpeted apt. I calculated the cost of the transportation, the rental fee and the cleansers required for the rental of the mammoth steamer, and realized the Bissell steamer would pay itself off in less than two rentals. It does an excellent job overall. It took a bit longer to dry, but with fans running all day and the windows open, most of the carpets were dry in 1 day.
customer_reviews.author: Swan

customer_reviews.title: It came in a sturdy box. It was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We used our Bissell carpet cleaner, model #1622 for the first time today. It came in a sturdy box. It was easy to assemble. We read the instructions. It was simple to use. We did two bedrooms, in about 40 minutes. The machine removes so much of the solution, that the carpets were totally dry in about 4 hours. We have a small dog, and I do believe any "doggy smell", has been removed. This was a great purchase for us. We are very pleased. Amazon thank you for such great service and recommendations. UPDATE: Went to use it the 2nd time and the belt broke...NO LIKE
customer_reviews.author: BarbsMcG

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to clean the carpets in my kids rooms before I redid them for Christmas. If you can imagine how yucky the carpet would be on the bedrooms of 2 four year olds, this thing had quite the jon cut out. It worked well and did not leave the carpet too wet. It the carpet dried fast and I know it cleaned deep because the dirt didn't resurface after the carpet was walked on. I only took off one star because the triggering mechanism wasn't working after the 2nd or 3rd time i used it, but there ooh s a warranty and I've had it repaired at a place within a mile from my house.
customer_reviews.author: Rye

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with how well this deep cleans
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with how well this deep cleans! My carpets were way overdue for a cleaning.. and it was extremely evident after I had used the Bissell PowerLifter. It sucked up so much dirt, and pet hair, I was having to change the tank after several "sweeps". I was concerned at first when the water wasn't flowing, and it appeared to stop working, but it was only letting me know that it was time to empty the tank and fill up fresh clean water. Great investment, decent price for the well-done job.
customer_reviews.author: EME

customer_reviews.title: The verdict is still out on this product. Although ...
customer_reviews.text: The verdict is still out on this product. Although it cleaned carpet very well 5* it seems to have some issues; Makes popping/suction noise from time to time for unknown reason~carpet was thoroughly vacuumed prior to using. Also, spits out carpet fragments periodically. Don't think that is supposed to occur. Have had previous experience with rentals that did the same thing. As long as it cleans for many future uses, I'll deal with issues. It will pay for itself over time, and It's convenient ~ don't have to rent public shampoo machine. Prevents transferring someone else's dirt onto my carpet.
customer_reviews.author: G-Lo

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I like this machine as it was a/easy to put together (I am not mechanically inclined) b/it is easy to fill and empty the tank c/it cleans the carpets well d/it really sucks!......up the water it dispenses :-) d/it is lightweight and e/it was relatively inexpensive. What I didn't like was the lack of complete instructions. I like to know everything about the machine/product I am using and the instruction manual was only a pamphlet.
customer_reviews.author: Diane J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING product
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Bissell powersteamer in 2006 and used it happily for 13 years until the motor died. Just bought this new powersteamer and am thrilled to be able to still clean my own carpets (at 73 years old). Does a great job and the changes they made since 2006 are for the better.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Shankle

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I needed to get some pet stains out of the carpet quickly. This was the most affordable carpet cleaner I found on amazon. It does the job. No fancy options or settings, but it is simple and does a great cleaning job on flat carpet. I did not use it on stairs, but see that as being a difficult task.
customer_reviews.author: R Jasinski

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice machine and does what it is suppose to. Shampoos carpet deep with great suction. My only complaint is that it is a beast to clean out after you use it. There is no easy way. It's kinda heavy and awkward. If you just dont care to keep it clean that's up to you but I like to keep all my stuff clean. You have to flip it upside down in a sink or outside with a hose maybe and try to get all the debris out without getting water in the electronic vents. Other that that works great. Not for stairs though.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaner at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is smaller than the one we had been using, to be fair I did read the reviews that the tank is smaller so you have to empty and refill often. That IS the only downfall I can find as it did a fantastic job cleaning our carpets that were ever so generously dirtied by two German Shepherds. Our other cleaner is also a Bissell with all the bells and whistles to go with it, we never once used the hose or attachments so that is why I went with this model to replace it. (I broke a plastic piece off while replacing a belt and could not get it to work right again so that was my bad)
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for light to medium duty.
customer_reviews.text: We do not wear shoes in the house, so I can say that my carpets aren't bad as what seem people seem to show. But they are still prone to spills and the occasional plant tipping over. So I would say that the PowerLifter is good for light to medium duty. Pros: Cons: Inexpensive Required to fill the water bladder a few times for a single 12x12 room. Not too heavy Hair around the brush isn't easy to remove... Good suction Not good for stairs. Easy to clean afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy...

customer_reviews.title: The basics
customer_reviews.text: We've used several carpet cleaners over the past 30 years, from the early roll around Bissell to a recent Hoover. When the last machine broke shortly within a year (motor failure). We opted to try this basic unit, IMO this is the perfect unit for us, no extras that are rarely used, downsized single container (easier to do a few loads vs. store with fluid). Typically these units start failing due to seals (poor suction). With this unit the seals are minimal and cleanup is easy vs. some of the other units.
customer_reviews.author: mrp

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Carpet Shampooer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Shampooer for my New House that has White Carpets. I bought the very basic Shampooer for $79. I don't need the extra attachments. I already have a Bissell Uphaulstry/Spot Shampooer. So I didn't need All the extras. I Used for the 1st time in 2 bedrooms. A couple of light stains I cleaned today & this Upright Bissell got them up. Easy to Assemble by myself & Easy to Use. I would recommend to Family or a Friend.

product_meta.description:
Style:PowerLifter

BISSELL PowerLifter PowerBrush Upright Deep Cleaner, 1622

12 amp full-size upright carpet cleaner with 4-row rotating DirtLifter PowerBrush Removes deep-down grit and stains using hot tap water and detergent Removable nozzle; lint screen; 2-in-1 water tank for easy filling and emptying Built-in measuring cup; 16-ounce bottle of Fiber Cleansing Formula included Measures 19 by 11 by 44 inches; 1-year limited warranty 12 amp full-size upright carpet cleaner with 4-row rotating DirtLifter PowerBrush Removes deep-down grit and stains using hot tap water and detergent Removable nozzle; lint screen; 2-in-1 water tank for easy filling and emptying Built-in measuring cup; 16-ounce bottle of Fiber Cleansing Formula included Measures 19 by 11 by 44 inches; 1-year limited warranty



AMAZON.COM
Dirt is a normal part of a carpet's everyday wear and tear--but that dirt can get ground deep into a rug's fibers every time it's walked on, damaging them permanently. Portable, lightweight, and easy to use, the Bissell PowerLifter PowerBrush Upright Deep Cleaner protects and extends carpet life by removing deep-down grit and stains, using just hot tap water, deep-cleaning detergent, and its four-row rotating DirtLifter PowerBrush. Carpets are left clean, odor-free, even gently groomed for a polished look. The PowerLifter's user-friendly design includes thoughtful touches like a comfortable handle, quick-release cord hooks, a lint screen, and easy-to-maneuver wheels, as well as a built-in measuring cup and a removable nozzle for quick clean up. 

 In addition, the unit's two-in-one water-tank system features a heavy-duty bladder inside for clean water, which empties and mixes with the cleaning formula during operation. The dirty water that gets pulled out of the carpets collects around the outside of the bladder, which means the clean and dirty water never mix. The unit's wide cleaning path covers more ground in less time, while the 20-foot power cord spares users from unplugging and re-plugging when cleaning larger rooms. The PowerLifter is not a steam-cleaning machine, so don't expect the same results that steam can deliver. It is, however, an inexpensive alternative to professional cleaning, without the hassle and expense of carting a rental machine back and forth. The unit comes with a 8-ounce bottle of Fiber Cleansing Formula and a dual-purpose Scotchgard-enhanced detergent that both deep-cleans carpet and protects it from future dirt and stains. The 12 amp full-size upright deep cleaner measures 19 by 11 by 44 inches and carries a one-year limited warranty. --Mary Park
